Reviews.Title: “pleasantly suprising . clean cheerful . ideal for those on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: atowen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2012 for 4 nights. Booked through "last minute .com" . Need`nt have worried about Hotel. It was very clean , all staff very helpful & spoke good english. Room small`ish but very nice,ensuite excellent . location a little downtrodden. Breakfast room / Terrace small clean good variety continental breakfasts & replenished regularly. Only 3 mins walk to tram/bus stop( we are in our sixties ) then 3/4 mins to main terminus. All areas of ROME are well served by Tram bus metro from this point. Check out room 302 . Late Monday night a Ghost walked straight through in very little clothing. My family think I`m nuts, but it happened... Enjoy your trip. A.T.O

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for mini-break”
Reviews.Author: slm84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in February 2012 for 4 nights. We booked it as part of a 'Last Minute.com' package. I was very pleased with the hotel. The staff were very friendly and spoke good English. They were very helpful; recommending local restaurants, answering any questions and they looked after our luggage prior to our flight home. The room was a good size and was beautifully decorated with a very clean bathroom. Breakfast was provided in the cost and there was a good selection of pastries, cereals, cheeses and cold meats. (Being English, I just stuck to cereal and croissants...don't get the fascination with cold meats at breakfast!!) The hotel was literally a 2 minute walk from a supermarket, which was really useful in getting bottled water etc as it was so much cheaper than getting in the city centre. The hotel was about a 20 minute walk from the Colloseum which was quite a nice walk. It's also within walking distance from the main train station. I think this hotel was perfect for what we wanted, a base in order to explore Rome. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean. Cheap and cheerful. Not really 4 Star.”
Reviews.Author: Mr T
Reviews.Content: One bedroom for 4 nights. Room extremely small but clean. I was told that room contains a terrace but instead of a picturesque view you got an Alfa Romeo garrage. Very disappointed. The road where the Hotel is situated is also shabby. Staff polite and helpful. Breakfast served in a small seating area. No warm fried food but a selection of hams and boiled eggs as a substitute. Still, good local amenities. The hotel is a stonethrow away from the Metro which takes you to the city centre and only a few stops from Termini Station for those travelling to and from Rome Airport using the Express Rail Service. Internet service and mini bar cost extra. However, there is a few internet cafes and a small supermarket nearby to stock up on water and supply so you can avoid paying 3 Euros in the rip-off tourist locations. Hotel is ideal for those who want to spend most of the day sightseeing in Rome and return back somewhere small and clean to sleep in. Ideal for those travelling on a budget but the Hotel is remarkably unspectacupar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Iskandarov
Reviews.Content: What i liked most here is cleanliness, perfect service (starting from reception to kitchen) The only con was that rooms are small

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: alabama231
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister for 4 nights in Feb 212. We had a room at the front of the hotel. I struggle to understand why quite a few people say that the rooms are small, ours was perfectly adequate for our needs! At the end of the day you only sleep there! There was at least 2 feet around the bed, plus a desk and more room for bags etc... in the cove by the door! I believe the bed itself was too singles pushed together, but very comfortable (one of the pillows was rock hard though, luckily there were spares in the cupboard) The ensuite bathroom was nice as well, very clean. Overall a very clean, spacious, comfy room. At times the room got quite hot, but with the windows open and the air conditioning unit it quickly cools. Being at the front it did mean that it was quite noisy at times as the hotel is next to a tram line and main road, but it wasn't intrusive and its what you expect for being so close to the city centre. The staff were very friendly, all spoke english very well, the breakfast was nice (being English I struggle to understand the cheese and cold meat thing for breakfast!) but the cereal, pastries and breads were lovely! Plus they had tea bags available!! The staff recommended a restaurant round the corner, BoBo's I believe, and their pasta dishes were stunning!! We were also allowed to leave our bags at the hotel on our last day as we had an evening flight. It was about 20min walk to the colesseum / roman forum which was handy, and about 15mins in the other direction is the main train station. 2 mins away is a supermarket where we bought big bottles of water and snacks as it was more economical than buying things directly in the city. Thanks to the reviews of other people on this hotel, we were not surprised by the city tax that needs to be paid when you check out, I think it was 3euros per person per night. I 100% recommend this hotel, I could not fault it at all. Top place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - ideal for visiting Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jomarty
Reviews.Content: Booked three nights at the Best Roma with Last Minute with flights from Bordeaux and weren't disappointed. The staff were very welcoming and extremely helpful - great with directions, booking taxis and recommending restaurants (the best value we ate in was just round the corner in Il Tempio di Minerva where the staff go for lunch! Try the spaghetti with parmesan and freshly milled black pepper - excellent.) The hotel is very clean with marble everywhere. Bedrooms were on the snug side, but were well appointed with a spotlessly clean shower room and very comfortable beds. The breakfast was excellent. Various fresh breads, lovely natural yoghurt, cereals, fruit, cheese and cold meats. Very good coffee machine which used freshly grounds beans and fresh hot milk for capuccinos. The lady serving breakfast was very nice and cleared away tables quickly so we could sit together when it was busy. Good location for visiting Rome, a bit out of the way but quiet - our rooms backed onto the rear of the hotel with views over neighbouring houses which was interesting. Seems to be a lot of Chinese in the area. Felt safe when returning late at night. Metro a stone's throw away and taxis everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced hotel well connected to many attractions”
Reviews.Author: travellerKM185
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay in this hotel over a 5 night stay in Rome. It is well located for access to public transport to Rome's many attractions. The bedroom was somewhat small but well furnished and clean. The breakfast room gets very crowded in the mornings, however, but you can also have it on the terrace outside, weather permitting. The staff were very helpful as well advising us attractions to visit, though I must say that the day staff seemed to be better informed than the receptionists who were on in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for rome central”
Reviews.Author: Zaal E
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel via expedia, friendly and very clean rooms the usual small rooms in rome hotels but have everything you need . 15/20 min walk to colosseum after a great continental breakfast which is constantly being restocked, the area around the hotel does look slightly run down but dont worry about safety walked all around area at night with no worries. An added advantage was the large local super market at the end of the street where you can stock up on all provisions at local prices ie 1.8 Euros for 6 bottles of water upto 2/2.5 Euros for 1 bottle in the centre also have a deli & great wine selection. A great suprise was a local restaurant just around the corner called il Tempio di minerva (also on trip advisor) fantastic food & value. Fantastic visit thankyou .

Reviews.Title: “"well priced, small and bijou, very clean, good inclusive breakfast"”
Reviews.Author: anonymousfromlondon
Reviews.Content: The room was small, but in excellent condition with a new bathroom and very comfortable bed. The front desk staff were excellent and the breakfast of pastries, meats, eggs, breads and good coffee included gets you started in the morning. It is a 20 minute downhill walk to the Colosseum ( 25 mins back uphill!), 5 mins to metro, 15 mins to Termini station, 12 minutesto Top Bike tours, and whilst its on the far side of the city its easy to get around and see the sites. We got a good deal on the room and were reall impressed. We would stay here again at full price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and a great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: ben y
Reviews.Content: We got a very good deal for this hotel via Expedia, and we weren't sure how good it would be in view of the cheap price. We needn't have worried. The location is a bit run-down being close to the main railway station but it is convenient for transport links and sightseeing. The front desk staff were all knowledgeable and very helpful. The room was small but modern and well supplied with everything one might need, and overlooking the back (also with shutters) it was very quiet. The buffet breakfast was excellent - plenty of cereal, cakes, cold meats and cheese, boiled eggs, etc, etc. Altogether, we can't fault the hotel and would certainly return there.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: moreau g
Reviews.Content: situated near the railway station , this hotel is really nice.The bedroom was really like in fairytails .We have been considered like very important people. The staff is very competent speaking Italian Frensch andEnglish. People can smoke on a small terrasse on the top at the 4th stage .........The breakfast was perfect for us poor frenchies .......I'll certainly return in this hotel next time I'll go to Rome

Reviews.Title: “bad hotl”
Reviews.Author: Hawk80126
Reviews.Content: here are some pictures for you thinking of staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Best Roma, Roma Italy”
Reviews.Author: XRAD1
Reviews.Content: We really enjoy staying at this lovely hotel. The breakfast was yummy, it had a wide variety of items to choose from and a cozy dining room to eat in. The rooms are small but very nice. The hotel staff was very helpful in maping out local attractions, guiding us which subway and buses to use. The hotel is within walking distance to bus stops, subway entrances, and Terimini (City Center) the main railway station for Rome. It's very close to most major tourist attractions which makes it an ideal location. There is a market within a 1/2 blocks to buy wine, snacks, water or whatever you need. A few nice resturants within a 1/2 block that are resonable priced. Do visit the gellato factory just past the market on the opposite side of street for a delicious treat you will really enjoy!! I recommed this hotel and would stay there again if I ever return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Manager”
Reviews.Author: ciaragrimes
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely, the breakfast really nice and location pretty spot on. However on morning of check out the manager informed us that we owed 12 euro for Roman tax. This was the first time that tax had been mentioned. I explained that I had booked everything through last minute. He began to loose his temper shouting that last minute "were s***". I told him I was not prepared to pay the tax he then using a raised voice told us to complete a form, which was in Italian. I told him I did not understand Italian. I was paying for our drinks that we had at the bar the previous evening, he shouted "......I don't give a s*** about the drinks...." At this stage I thought it best I leave this rude foul tempered man alone as I feared what would happen next. So we walked out and he shouted after us "...you can f*** off....." He was a disgusitng excuse for a hotel manager.

Reviews.Title: “ParFor”
Reviews.Author: Lea B
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, very clean, but small. Of the seven hotels we stayed in during our tour of Italy, this is the only one where we ended up going to the local grocery store to buy our breakfast. No toast (or toaster), no fresh fruit, only hard boiled eggs.... In other words, breakfast sucked. Also, hotel is in a seedy area. We did not feel safe walking in the area after dark. Also, they charge for Internet and WiFi. Located on a side of the street where taxis will not pick you up or drop you off. You have to cross the street with your luggage and over the streetcar tracks to get to your hotel. Don't use hotel's limo service if you have more than three average sized bags because you'll end up with it on your lap.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: DxD_Guitarist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Best Roma in October and have to say that it was wonderful. The location was ideal for walking to the main sites and with easy access to the Metro and train station and although other reviews had made us wary of the neighbourhood, we found it to be nothing but ideal. The hotel itself and our room were very well presented and breakfast was to a high standard. The best thing about staying at this hotel though was undoubtedly the staff who were clearly hard working, always pleasant and very helpful to us in getting around Rome and fully enjoying our holiday. We would most definitely stay here again and recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “The ancient rome”
Reviews.Author: FredrikOlsson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Best Roma hotel in Rome during the start of june and it was really good. The hotel was fantastic, small and nice. The room was quite large with a good bathroom and a desk. A good thing was that there was aircondition in the room that you could control your self. However we got a room that faced the inner garden of the building so we was lucky and didn't hear the street outside the hotel but there was smoking allowed on in the garden/backyard so remember to shut your window if you leave the room unless you want it to smell smoke. The breakfast was ok, plastic cups aren't a plus but the food was good. Another downside with the hotel is that there are not included free internet access on the hotel, when we asked to use the internet we could pay 8 euros for 3 hours and that's a bit old fashioned. The overall grade was good and we would definitely stay at this hotel again if we go to rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but certainly not 4*”
Reviews.Author: CDinNI
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 4 nights during the past week. I had researched this extensively using TA and chose the hotel on that basis; I was not disappointed. The neighbourhood is not great but certainly not as bad as some others have indicated. I think it best to stay on Via Principe Amedeo and Via di Porta Maggiore (the tram route). Allow for 20 minutes to walk from Termini but one can ride the Tram (No. 5 or No. 14) or the 105 Bus. They all leave from the front corner of the Termini station. I will add USEFUL TIPs as I write the review. The young man at the reception desk was extremely pleasant and helpful. He provided me with a street map and wrote additional transport information on it. He brought our baggage to the room. The room was small, and friends accompanying us got an even smaller room, but I had expected that from the reviews. The more important thing was the fact that the room was clean and in every regard functional. In fact the whole place was clean as the hotel has been completely refurbished. Breakfast was basic (cereals; bread rolls; croissants and ham/cheese) but tasty. The problem once again was the rather cramped dining facility. Most people chose to remain inside even though the weather was exceptional for October. There is a wi-fi but it did not work in my bedroom. It cost about 6 or 7 Euro for 3 hours. Transport tickets can be purchased at the news stand at Piazza di Porta Maggiore - out of hotel and turn left; walk less than 5 minutes and it is on the same side as hotel. I had never been in Rome before and was not really prepared for the 'transport'. Sardines in a tin spring to mind. Little wonder there is a problem with pick-pockets. There are so many people allowed on buses; metro and trams that it is a pick-pockets paradise. I caught a guy 'moving in' on me on the No. 3 bus. I promptly threw him off the bus at the next stop - NOT recommended for most people. A couple with us were victims on the same bus but the thief only got the hotel room pass which he discarded on the floor of the bus. The metro from Manzoni station is just as bad. Of course we were travelling during the rush-hour (perhaps rush-hours is more apt in Rome as it always seems busy) but anywhere near the centre or tourist sites makes for quite a challenge. It really must be a nightmare if one has young children. A visit to Trastevere is recommended and the No. 3 bus leaving from Piazza di Porta Maggiore (out of hotel and a five minute walk to the left) goes there. We also used the same bus to go to the Colosseum. We used the tram from Manzoni to the Vatican. That is out of hotel and turn right. Walk to the next major junction and turn left. The station is down this road. Allow around 10 minutes for this walk. If going to St. Peters then get off at Ottaviano. If going to the Vatican museums then stay until the next stop and get off there. If planning on both i recommend one goes to the Vatican Museum FIRST. When in the Sistine chapel look for the door on the right as you walk down it. This is exclusively for TOUR GROUPS but hook up with a group and walk out through that door. The exit for individuals leaving the Chapel is actually on the left and this will bring you back into the Museum complex. If you leave with a tour group you will be in St. Peters within a few minutes. This will save you 45-60 minutes as the other route takes you out on to the public street leaving you o walk to St. Peters and join the security queue. Incidentally we did not have tickets for the museum so had to queue. We arrived there at just after 9am and had to queue for 40 minutes (even in Oct). The other important issue is BACKPACKS. If you have a backpack you will likely have to leave it in security after you enter. No big deal but it will mean tracking back from the Sistine Chapel to recover it. This will mean no 'short cut' to St. Peters for you. The best restaurant from the hotel was up the street to the right and then the main street to the right (I think it was Manzoni) and the restaurant is on the right. This is 5 minutes from hotel and is popular. Incidentally no credit cards accepted. The best supermarket is out of hotel and up the street to the right. It is on the other side of the street at the bus/tram stop just on the corner of the first major junction. It is less than 5 minutes walk. I would stay again at this Hotel but it certainly does not have the facilities to merit a 4* rating.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: LeeAnn600
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel Months in advance, as soon as I arrived in Rome, the guy at the desk booked me at another hotel saying the hotel electricity was down, though I could see other guests arriving to their rooms, being jet-lagged I let him put me in a taxi to another hotel a smelly no-air single-bed no mini-frige room with staffed with people that treated me like a homeless person. No slippers, no robe, no lux room as promise no bathtub. I had trip insurance also and CheapO.com wouldn't help me!

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for visiting Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Sher164
Reviews.Content: A great base for visiting Rome. The Coloseum is 15mins walking distance away, the Metro is 10mins away, Tram/Bus stops 5mins. Main train station (Termini) can be reached in 15mins by Trams no's 5 or 14 or bus 105 which stops right outside station and 5mins from hotel. Very helpful friendly staff who speak many different languages fluently. You can book Hop on/off site seeing tour at reception. Rooms are a little small but as you are out most of the day this really doesn't matter. Breakfast is basic but filling continental style. I have no problem in recommending this hotel. Tip. Buy a day or 3 day ticket from the tobacconists 200yrds from hotel. (out of hotel turn left) This is valid for bus, tram and Metro. 4€ for 1 day 11€ for 3 days. Well worth the money. Tip. Use the Supermarket opposie to buy lunch to take with you as food and drink in the tourist areas are very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I´ve ever stayed...”
Reviews.Author: Nadine M
Reviews.Content: The room, especially the bathroom, was great! Huge shower! Roommates were friendly and our room was everey day clean. We always got valueable information at the reception and the breakfast was good. All in all a wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, loved the service... well most of it.”
Reviews.Author: abigail t
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, very nice staff, there is an excellent reseraunt called cici de pepe about three blocks toward the station. Neighborhood was seedy at times but location was wonderful. within walking distance of everything in historic rome!!! the only complaint i had was with a particular fellow at the desk who flipped out on me for taking a bottle of some fizzy drink from a bowl filled with ice. he acted like i was trying to steal it!!!!! I think they need to put a sign out that says ask for assistance if you want one of our stupid fizzy drinks. Other than that, i would definetly stay again. This hotel is excellently priced for how wonderful it is! Fantastic deal!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but adequate and close to a metro station-about a block & a half”
Reviews.Author: equadmom
Reviews.Content: It's also pretty close to the main train station--Termini. We were able to get to all the major attractions pretty easily with our family of 6. It is pretty typical of European hotels from my experience. No restaurant, but they serve continental breakfast. The A/C really works, so no worries there. The biggest drawback for us was the fact that the internet was not free, like we are accustomed to in the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little hotel, great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: lydianic
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Best Roma for 5 days and wished we could have spent longer. Generally, the hotel is very nice, and quiet at night. Our room was large enough and very chic with modern decor and wooden floors. Furthermore, it was extremely clean, and cleaned everyday afterwards whilst we were out. The room overlooked a very pleasant garden to the rear, where breakfast and evening drinks were served. The staff were friendly and very helpful giving directions and recommending restaurants. The hotel is only 5 mins walk to Manzoni underground station, so it's very easy to get around the whole of Rome within minutes (it took about 20 mins to get from Manzoni to Vatican City on the underground). When the underground closes at 9pm, taxis are not hugely expensive (we got a taxi from Testaccio to the hotel,at 3am, for 15 euros). Breakfast was the typical selection of meats, cheeses, breads, cereals and juices. Though, there is a supermarket and cafes/restaurants just down the street. All in all, it was a great hotel for our week of sightseeing and nights out (24 hour open reception was very helpful).

Reviews.Title: “The best in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: EFTHIMIADIS
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels we have ever stayed for its price. We stayed for 8 nights 2 adults and 3 teenagers. The rooms (1 double and 1 triple) were extremely clean, comfortable and beautifully decorated. Breakfast was delicious with a variety of coffees and desserts eaten in a beautiful garden. The staff were very polite and helpful. Metro station, buses and tram were close by so it was very easy to move around. We will definitely stay here in our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Average 'Best Roma' for us”
Reviews.Author: Tash103
Reviews.Content: Based on previous reviews, I would have to agree that the hotel probably isnt in the best location, but the hotel inside does make up for it. The rooms were excellent, with a large bed and very clean. The bathroom was generous in size and had a large window in the room that opened right up. We actually had a problem with the fridge in our room, which caused a big problem throughout our stay here. To save our pennies, we decided to buy groceries from the supermarket down the road & keep it in the fridge, only it wasnt working. We asked staff to fix it, which they can immediately to look at and said a guy would be here the next day to fix it. Next day came, and still wasnt fixed, dispite someone coming into look at it. They kindly let us use the hotel kitchens fridge for our food, but it was quite annoying having to trouble them each time. Each day we would ask when it would be fixed, and it still wasnt fixed when we left. Extremely annoying! There is a nice courtyard on the roof top, where you can relax in the sun on a lounger. Note: you are not allowed to bring food or drinks here unless purchased from the hotel. They are quite firm on this. We would like to mention that the gentlemen who works on reception during the day is extremely helpful, and knows the attractions and area very well, and speaks good english. He made our stay a good one as well as the ladies who serve the breakfast. They were so lovely. Also the breakfast is excellent here, it should be included in your rate. Provides everything you need, and a little extra!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in beautiful Roma :)”
Reviews.Author: holmesly
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weeks stay at this hotel. We have no complaints it was a lovely hotel. Our room was small but nice, very clean, clean sheets and towels everyday. Breakfast was good, continental. Loved the coffee machine, would be rude not to start the day with an expresso!! A nice outside terrace area to eat. Reception was excellent, they give you a map with all the attractions and have plenty of infomation about getting to places etc etc, really helpful and friendly. The location of the hotel is good 5-10 mins from the termini (easy to find also) and again a 5-10 walk to the nearest metro stop Manzoni, we did use this but the best way to see Rome is on foot, we walked all over, feet sore but well worth it! alot of the main attactions are within walking distance, we didn't mind walking 20-30mins at a time, plenty to see and do en route! wouldn't say the hotel was in the best area of Rome but we often came in late at night and never felt threatened or scared, it was clean and locals seemed really friendly. We would definately reccommend this hotel for value for money! Wan to go back to Rome got the holiday blues already! P.s Just a tip to fellow travellers, we saved loads of money in the day by drinking the fresh water from the pumps scattered all over the city (keep an empty bottle handy) Its perfectly fine and fresh to drink! bottles of water to buy from street vendors can charge up to 3euro or 4euro for a coke!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: veganrr
Reviews.Content: Rome was our introduction to Italy and Best Roma was our first hotel. We were warned about room sizes in Europe and we were not in for a shock or anything. The people are great and very helpful. The rooms are nicely kept and the breakfast was good. Nothing to complain about!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stat”
Reviews.Author: hilly_82
Reviews.Content: Room was a twin. Had air con and plenty of room. Bathroom modern and clean with v good shower.excellent concierge service and nice outdoor terrace where you can eat breakfast or have drinks. Walking distance from colosseum (30 mins ) and 5 mins from line a metro. Would def stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Really sweet personal hotel with excellent concierge staff”
Reviews.Author: Gems1984
Reviews.Content: We read about this hotel on Tripadvisor before booking with Expedia and noted that the location isn't the nicest, which in terms of all Rome, it probably isn't. We got a bit sidetracked on the way from the Termini station and ended up walking through an alley past some kind of rehabilitation shelter were lots of men were drinking on the street. No one gave us any trouble but it was a bit intimidating. But once you pass that the area is a normal bustling downtown area. The hotel was fantastic though and a really good price. We had to get metros/buses to all of the sights but they are very easy to use and the concierge staff are extremely helpful in telling you how to get around, where to go, where to eat, what to see, what time of day to go etc. The rooms were smallish but big enough for my Mum and I to get our two cases in! The bathroom was nicely decorated and the shower was divine! There were nice shutters and good double glazed windows. We didn't hear a sound all night apart from on the Saturday when a nearby disco played late into the night, but if it wasn't for the good quality windows we would have been disturbed! Air conditioning was excellent as it is sometimes a bit hit and miss in smaller hotels. Comfortable bed and mini bar and safe in room. Our room overlooked the terrace where you can eat breakfast which is really nice and there is a sun terrace on the roof which they provide a bar service for too. Breakfast was typical continental, much better than I have had in other European hotels, and lovely smiley hospitality staff. Overall, really good value and an excellent choice, as long as you are happy using public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Good escaped”
Reviews.Author: SuperBock
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel; small and friendly. Good hotel for a weekend get way to Rome it's 5 min walk from the Central train station and subway.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff...very pleased :)”
Reviews.Author: urbanspirit
Reviews.Content: Booked online from thomas cook well in advance of traveling roughly 10 months and therfore got a great price. Also bought transfers from airport to hotel and vice versa for roughy £50 for the two of us cheap compared to the taxis which wanted min 40 euros each way so a tip is book in the uk, no probs with the tansfers booked, quick and efficent. Hotel is approx 20mins walk to the collessum, room was bright and clean, beds comfortable, shower room compact but nicely decorated and fitted out so cant really complain. Our room was over looking the rear courtyard, can hear the trains at night, they run till 11.30pm and then start again at 5.30am but due to all the walking we did we slept like a log and didnt hear anything untill 7ish when breakfast is up and running. Staff friendly, polite no problem here, very helpful even though there was a language barrier with one of the receptionists but this was eventually sorted. Breakfast as stated in previous reviews, constists of fruit juice, coffes etc chees, salami and ham, plus rolls, pastries and cereal are avaliable, eat as much as you want we sure did or rather I did.... Overall, great little hotel, area surrounding not as bad as what other reviews state, even at night, felt safe walking back to hotel. Mrs and I wil def be back again.......

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Alphen aan den Rijn, The Netherlands
Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Above our expectations”
Reviews.Author: ScreamerHS
Reviews.Content: We went to Italy for a small week and decided to book this hotel, which was a very good choice! Best Roma Hotel is close by Termini train station and is only 10 minutes walking. When we entered the hotel a very nice guy helped us checking in and showed us the way to our room. The room, but also the hallway was amazing. Marble everywhere! Everything was very clean and was shiny! The bed was perfect, and slept very well. In other previews I saw people complaining about the noise outside. In our room, 306 there was no noise at all. In fact, the window was very thick and made of a very high quality material. I was kinda surprised by it. If you open the windows you see its 5CM thick and heavy material. The bathroom was not big, but also not that small. It was very clean and everyday it was clean when we came back and fresh new towels left behind. The room had airco in it and was very nice during the night. The ceiling was also very nice decorated and was a pleasant view from the bed. The staff was very helpful and helped us with finding a very good restaurant close by and helped us making a tour and telling us what train/metro and bus numbers we had to take. This hotel only serve breakfast, but it was good. Fresh bread, cheese etc and drinks every morning. The choice was not much, but was alright for us and tasted good. The train/metro and bus stations are very close by and just a few min walking from the hotel. If you like walking, the Colosseum is not that far, just 20-30 min walking. We even walked back from the Trevi Fountain to the hotel, but can't remember how long it took but it was do-able. Overall this hotel was above our expectations and we can recommended it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: 2travelersnow
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet. The location is convenient to the train station and many sights in Rome. ( We walked everywhere, but the bus is quite near.) Breakfast is buffet style and is quite good

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TSWilliams
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Best Roma in April 2011 as we wanted a nice cheap hotel where we could discover the joys of Rome. The hotel is decorated to very nice standards, the rooms are clean and whilst not the most spacious have more than enough room to move around in. There is a mini bar with fairly sensible prices for drinks etc and of course you can fill the fridge with your own drinks if required. There is also air conditioning, although we didn't require it on our trip. Breakfast was a buffet with a fairly limited range, cereals, pastries, cheese and meats etc, but it would have been nice to be able to get some fruit as an alternative to eat in a morning. Anyone with allergies to wheat or diary would struggle with the buffet. It's only about a 15 min walk from Termini so not too far when you are dragging your luggage along behind you. It took about 20 min to walk to the Collesseum. The area the hotel is in is not the nicest in Rome, and this I think is reflected in the price, but we never felt threatened or uncomfortable walking to or from the centre late at night. For those that cant handle the walking a taxi from the centre of town to the hotel cost about 10E. If you come out of the hotel and turn left you come to a piazza with some restaurants which we didnt discover until our last day, which is a shame as we would have loved to try them. To the right is a supermarket where you can buy anything else you might need. The staff in the hotel were lovely and very helpful whenever we needed anything. Our flights home were evening ones, but the hotel were happy to look after our bags for the day so that we were able to carry on exploring the city without worrying about them. All in all the hotel was great, the beds comfy and the rooms clean. What more do you really need in Rome?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel but watch out”
Reviews.Author: daveNh
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a group of 15 recentlly. Hotel was nice, decent size rooms which had been recently renovated. Located close to the subway, but definitely not walking distance to Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain as they suggest. Lovely small roof top terrance and courtyard off the dining area.. Market close by. We wnt there to pruchase some wine and cheese for happy hour. When we got back to hotel we were told we could not use the outside terrace as they had an afternoon bar and you had to buy from them., 13 Euro for a glass of chardonnay., no thanks- went to upstairs terrance, as we were told to do. Last night barman came up and told us this would be the last night we could use the terrace as we had to buy drinks from them. No probem- as we were leaving next day. .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to amenities, comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: jfay82
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Hotel Best Roma fresh from Australia, our first European trip. It was an easy walk from the train station. The hotel was very clean and easily located to the metro. It is close walking distance to all major attractions (except the Vatican is further away) and so easy to get around. Bathroom was very small but that's the worst criticism I can give.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dea421753
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 6 nights at the Hotel Best Roma with 8 other travelers (3 teenagers and 6 adults) on our spring break; we had 4 rooms: 1 triple and 3 doubles. The rooms were more than wonderful! The triple was more spacious than the doubles, but that is to be expected in Europe. The rooms were air conditioned, spotlessly cleaned each day, and super quiet (a plus in Rome). The breakfast each day was delicious: juice, coffee, cappuccino, cereals, pastries, meats, etc. Check-in and check-out were very easy. The staff was extremely accommodating, especially with directions and help with dinner reservations. Internet can be purchases for €7 for 3 hours, and it was very quick. There is a lovely rooftop terrace and another terrace just off the breakfast room. The neighborhood is a little out of the way, but the #3 bus picks up just one block away at the Porta Maggiore and goes to the Colosseum. The #810 bus and the Metro (red line) pick up a few blocks away at Via di Manzoni; the bus goes to Piazza Venezia and the Metro goes to Termini and the stop near the Spanish Steps. We took the train to Termini from the airport and then the #105 bus to the hotel. I do not recommend the huge gelato factory down the street from the hotel - by far the worst gelato I had all week. We ate twice at Il Tempio di Minerva just a few blocks from the hotel; excellent food and lots of fun with the waiters!

Reviews.Title: “Modern boutique hotel close to Termini station”
Reviews.Author: brads_clarke
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 17 year old daughter for one week 12 to 19 April 2011. The rooms were small but newly and tastefully decorated and furnished. They were very clean and were cleaned with fresh towels everyday. The location was a bit noisy with road and rail traffic but not so much to render sleep impossible. It is in the Ancient part of Rome and handy for rail and metro links and if you are an able walker you can get to some sights on foot. The area is a bit run down and I would not recommend you bring children here. (I was disappointed generally with the amount of litter and graffiti all around Rome). Breakfast was basic continental buffet and there are two terraces for guest usage. The breakfast lady was friendly but the reception staff lacked any spark. If you eat out go to Minerva and you can use the big supermarket on the corner. You have use of a free safe. Pillows are flat so ask for extra if you need them. I did not use the internet so not sure what good value that was. To sum up I would say that if you want a clean, modern place to crash at the end of a long days sight seeing then stay here but if you want to be in the thick of central Rome with all its noise and places to access easily at night then pay more and get something further in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a little out of the way..”
Reviews.Author: ChTruffles
Reviews.Content: About a 20 minute walk from Termini - not sure I would recommend the walk to a single female arriving at night, but during the day it would be fine. The hotel itself was vey nice. Our room was lovely - facing a courtyard, gorgeous wood floors with marble in the bathroom. Room was quiet at night (once those in the courtyard departed). We could sometimes feel a low rumble when the streetcar went by, but it was more like white noise and did not disturb us. Room was quite spacious - the double bed was two singles pushed together. There was a safe, fridge, wardrobe and a tv (Italian only). Bathroom appeared to be renovated - good layout with relatively spacious shower (square vs. corner). Amenities were provided. Internet was 7€ for 3 hours. Breakfast was standard - rolls, cheese, ham, coffee, juice & hardboiled eggs. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great service from some.”
Reviews.Author: Barbara_Oakes
Reviews.Content: The hotel was close to the train station. We knew there was no bar be read that the patio was great for a bottle of wine and snacks. Which it was. It was clean and tidy, The value was great. Guanluca welcomed us to the hotel and was absolutely wonderful. helpfull, kind and full of information. The weekend staff were not so helpful and we ended up helping new guests that came in. Breakfast was basic but great, you could eat as much as you like. We had rooms on the ground floor near reception and was a little noisy at times. Especially one night when the hoover was being used at 3am. Would I stay here again, YES. But would ask for rooms higher in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Roma is Worst Hotel Roma (March 24, 2011)”
Reviews.Author: cmurff3
Reviews.Content: We booked “Best Hotel Roma” in December 2010 for our March trip to Italy based on pricing and reviews in Orbitz and Trip Advisor. Thirty days before arriving we requested and received via email a confirmation for our night at “Best Hotel Roma”, which was the last night of our 25 days in Italy. Upon arrival we were informed of a “problem”…there were no rooms in the hotel, so we were placed in a crappy room with a couch that converted to a bed in the property next door “owned by the hotel”. When I complained about the room I was given the choice of another room in the basement of the same building, which was smelly and dark and also just had a fold out bed. I complained again and was told that I might have a room in a couple of hours…so we went to eat and then for a long walk only to return to same situation. The manager offered us dinner (but we had just eaten a late lunch) or transfer to the airport, which we took for compensation…all while we stood watching other guests being checked into their nice rooms in the main hotel. It seems that “Best Hotel Roma” does not know the definition of RESERVATION or CONFIRMATION but after 25 days on the road we took the airport transfer and stayed in the crappy room with the fold out bed, no TV, no hair dryer, no Wi-Fi, no trash can, a sink that would not drain and a shower that my wife refused to use, all while being serenaded by the street bums, traffic and the tram. Our last night in Rome was our worst night while staying at “Worst” Hotel Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: samandmarge
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you need to be near Roma Termini. It's along the bus and electric trains that will take you to the terminal where you can catch trains, buses, underground railways and electric trains to almost every destination from Rome. The rooms are updated with your own private bathrooms. The breakfast selections are fantastic and the woman who prepares the breakfast is great in giving you your own bottled water, most people might not consider this a big deal, but when you have to pay over 3 Euros for a small bottle of water and she gives you a liter, you'll appreciate her thoughtfulness. The front desk staff, especially Jean Luca is wonderful. I believe he is the Manager and he is very accommodating! If you end up staying there, be sure to ask about a restaurant called Minerva, great food at reasonable prices. Red is also good, just a bit more pricey. In Rome and with a moderate budget, this hotel would be my #1 choice, especially if I have to travel by train to other destinations. We stayed there for 11 nights and we never had a problem!

Reviews.Title: “Best small hotel”
Reviews.Author: chelseablue-11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a city break to Rome. Stayed at the Hotel Best Roma. This is a lovely small hotel. We stayed just outside the main town, which has some pretty sights. The hotel offers bed and breakfast only. The Hotel is clean, rooms where comfortable, staff where extremley helpful, particurly the manager, who spoke good english. Breakfast was buffet, plenty of it. got busy when every one arrived at the same time for breakfast though, but tables where constantly cleared. I would recommend this hotel, was reasonably priced as well. Has a lovely little outside seating area. Hotel was a 10 min walk to the main station, but there is a metro stop not far from the hotel. We used a green open tour bus to see the sights. You can then get on and off at sights that you want to visit. Tour cost us 25euros for 48 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, newly-renovated hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Shampagne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Best Roma from July 9 - 11, 2010. We arrived early, and our room was not ready, but they did get it ready for us before the 3:00 PM check-in time, while we went out to lunch. The hotel is very close to Termini, the main train station, so it is a great place to stay if you are travelling to other cities by train, like we were. There is also another metro station, even closer, so it is convenient for metro travel for sightseeing. The hotel is not right in the touristy spots, which I kind of liked; although it is within walking distance to the Colosseum, Forum, and art museum, and an easy metro ride to the Vatican. The room was small, but well-updated and very clean. The bathroom was also quite small, but we expected this. The bathroom also appeared to be recently renovated and clean. There is a TV in the room, and it actually gets an English channel (BBC), which is nice. They offer a free continental style breakfast, and the hotel has WiFi available, although you have to pay for it (7 euros for 3 hours, I think), and the hotel gets passwords from an outside service provider. When we were there, they had run out of passwords. The staff said they could get us a password later, but we didn't bother. Overall, I thought it was a great place to stay. I thought the price was reasonable, and we had a good experience at Hotel Best Roma.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn'f fault this place in any way”
Reviews.Author: vanita001
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel and we can't find anything negative to say about it. OK, it's not in the heart of town but you can walk there in minutes. Very peaceful, good staff.

Reviews.Title: “After a LONG decision,we decided to go with this hotel.............”
Reviews.Author: perfectoriginal
Reviews.Content: And it was nearly perfect! Its a 5 minute walk from the Termini station,which services the airport and underground from the city so your never far from anywhere and if you dont mind a bit of a walk - 15-20 minutes and your at the trevi fountain and all the other attractions. The staff we're excellent on arrival - helping us figure out which tram number , location of attractions etc.The room was a bit small and we could hear the guests next door at times ( when they came in drunk i might add , the staff told them to keep it down ) but overall the experience was pleasant and id definely stay again if i ever return! The area the hotel is situated in doesnt look like much , but i can assure you that there is some very cheap , gorgeous restaurants just 2-3 min walking distance in either direction and there is a supermarket just down the road . All in all , if your looking for a cheap , cosy ( i forgot the mention that the hotel is very small ) charming place to stay that isnt far from attractions then this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean & Close to Termini the main train station”
Reviews.Author: conniesouky
Reviews.Content: Great stay, clean rooms. Stayed there 3 nights all up, on different occasions, each time great service & clean. Within walking distance to the Main Rome Train station which made it easy to get everywhere. Great place - a little pricey, but I would still definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Nice Price”
Reviews.Author: Julia35805
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed by quality of this hotel. It is very clean, service is outstanding, room is spacious, nice bathroom, very pleasant breakfast buffet, charming patio. From airport it worth to take a taxi which costs about $40, otherwise, trip by train and then metro is very exhausting and not much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, not nice employees”
Reviews.Author: EarthGopher
Reviews.Content: The service was the biggest problem for us. The other couple we were staying with had a horrible experience with their room but our room was quite nice. Fairly spacious, very clean and modern. There's a nice outdoor patio area in the back. The staff was half good, half terrible. The terrible staff was mostly in the evening when simple requests like an extra blanket or a wake-up call was almost impossible and a very unfriendly experience. The location is a little scruffy and about 20 minutes walk from the main train station. The nearest metro is 10 minutes on foot. Not the best location for those reasons but fairly safe. Not an area for food or entertainment for sure. I would say that the value for the money is more or less right. I wouldn't, however, stay here again for the incompetent service alone.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good, for the price”
Reviews.Author: nikdu
Reviews.Content: Okay, I am giving this hotel high marks CONSIDERING THE PRICE and not because they are that good compared to all other establishments. My mom and I stayed here for two nights in the first week of July 2010, and that was right after a 10-night cruise on the Celebrity Equinox. That having been said, even though we went from a luxury cruise liner to this little hotel, we still found it pretty good, considering how much we paid for the rooms. The area is not very difficult to find if you're in a taxi, and the hotel actually is rather close to Metro stations Termini (where we took the hop on/off bus) and Vittorio Emanuele. Easy walk to both; however, I would have to agree with everyone who said that it is a scary neighborhood to walk at night. There are many people (mostly groups of men) drinking and smoking on the sidewalks of the streets along Termini, so I suggest taking a right turn down Via Cavour from Termini (or any other street that would take you away from the back street), then make your way towards Via di Porta Maggiore. The streets have more human traffic, the lights are brighter, and there are shops and restaurants lining the streets. The hotel reception staff are really nice and they speak english well. They are very patient in answering whatever questions you have, and they will happily give you - for free - the most important tool you need: a map of the city. The housekeeping though had trouble communicating with us, especially when we took the wrong elevator and ended up on the wrong side of the hotel. Yes, there are two elevators, and if you are bringing heavy luggage and took the wrong one by mistake, you would have to go down to the hotel Trattoria just to switch elevators. It is not difficult, nor that much of a hassle; just a bit inconvenient. Point to remember: while checking in at reception, ask which elevator to take. We finally got to our rooms, which were even smaller than our inside staterooms on the ship; they were clean though, had a large cabinet, a safe inside said cabinet, and even a small refrigerator in the little cabinet underneath the writing desk. Our room was one of those with a balcony, but we weren't bothered by the noise outside. Maybe we were just really tired after a full day of sight-seeing, but for both nights, we slept really well. The bed is narrower than I'm used to and bouncy, but that didn't bother me or my mother. One thing that did bother me a little bit though, was the TV. There was nothing wrong with the unit, but there were no english channels except BBC news. This is insignificant for some, but for those who like to unwind with the TV, you would have to learn Italian to understand anything. The bathroom is bigger than I expected; I honestly expected a small cubicle of a bathroom, but this one was half the size of the bedroom. There was of course a toilet, a little secondary toilet for washing (i forgot what it's called), a good-sized sink with space on both sides for cosmetics and whatnots, a shower with enough space to shampoo your hair without hitting your elbows on the glass, and there was.. a HAIR DRYER (oh joy). The towels were changed everyday, toiletries were provided, the rubbish bins were emptied, and oh, I must not forget to mention that on the bedroom side of the bathroom sliding door is a HUGE mirror that is actually the entire size of the door; very important for girls like my me and my mother. The Trattoria is only open for breakfast, and the food I think, is outsourced from other bakeries and shops. It was the same for the 3 days that we were there: sweet pastries; bread rolls; cheese, ham, and salami slices; and different kinds of cereals to choose from. Of course there was also butter and soft cheese to spread on the rolls. The orange juice machine had pretty good juice; I did not try the coffee though, so I can't comment on that. Now, even though it's a rather limited buffet, it is still a buffet; so you can eat as many croissants and ham-and-cheese sandwiches as you want until you're full. In conclusion, it's not a bad place to be in, and I believe I would stay in this hotel again if I ever went back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: DenverTennisPlayer
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice. Recently remodeled. Staff very friendly. Convenient to Termini (helpful hint- take first side exit from the terminal if you come in on the train from the airport- cuts walk in half). We had 8 (4 couples) in our group- so we were able to get a shuttle cheaper than taking the train from the airport- cost us 78 euro total. Enjoyed the stay here- close to metro stops- nice grocery at the end of the street. We would get wine, snacks, cheese, etc. at the grocery and then have our own personal happy hour on the covered patio every night- it rained two nights, but we were still dry and comfy to discuss our day and the plans for the next day. Breakfast Buffet is normal Italian- good cappucino machine!

Reviews.Title: “Rather disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Sheerious
Reviews.Content: There were good parts and really bad parts to our stay at Rome Best Hotel - 1. i have never seen a SMALLER room - we actually couldn't open our luggage, we couldn't move in the room at all- it was preferred that one of us would be in the bathroom or in bed . for a 3 * (or 4,i could actually understand as online it says 3 stars but at the hotel the logo shows 4 stars) hotel that room was indecently small! 2. we had no remote for the tv and when we started it from the buttons on the screen there was only a blue screen. The receptionist just looked blankly at us and said he would look at it - it took us 2 days and another receptionist to give us the remote and fix the tv. 3. it was actually rather far from the underground station (the closest was Manzoni) 4. the walls were so thin and you could hear all your neighbor's actions 5.one night the shower started to run out of the blue - it was actually scary 6. the central AC was not working although we were told it was supposed to- sometimes it was hot in the room. 7.the neighborhood was full of weird people, mostly immigrants and the overall feeling was that of insecurity + 1. the room was nicely decorated, the bathroom was neat and well equipped 2. there was a really big supermarket opposite to the hotel and about 4-5 restaurants right around the corner

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bruno_e_Carol
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the Train Station (Termini). The metro is located some 600 meters away. The neighborhood is weird and seems a little dangerous, we saw anyhing, but it is good to be aware. The room decor is very beautiful. It's very clean and well maintained. The Breakfast does not have much option but it is good and honest. Probably a forthcoming visit to Rome we will be in Best Rome Hotel. Recommend to friends. Also there is no free wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: wiganwarriorsfan
Reviews.Content: If you are travelling on a budget and looking for a good base for sight seeing this hotel is an excellent choice. It doesnt look much from the outside and the area of Rome it is situated is not the best but you never feel unsafe and inside the hotel it is clean and modern and the staff are all very helpful. Situated close to the train station and metro this is a good base for taking in the sights of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous rooms, well appointed bathroom, lovely staff"”
Reviews.Author: Drruthnewzealand
Reviews.Content: The manager who was Italian was fabulous, very helpful and spoke fantastic English. The cleaning lady/breakfast woman was lovely. Although the room was small it was beautifully decorated with a lovely bathroom and it felt all brand new. The bed was very comfortable and there was a fridge. The room had internet access. The whole hotel was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “A neat hotel , helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: PriyankaG
Reviews.Content: This is a nice small hotel , well kept and good staff. The Manzoni metro was near by and the Colosseum was walkable. Vatican had a direct train from Manzoni. However taxi was the most convenient way to travel if you wanted to go trastevere for yummy pizzas.Beware of the cabbies and the fares , we had mixed experience. The piazzas were not actually very far away if you can master the bus routes and the metro. Overall it was a pleasant experience. Oh, when in Rome surely do as the Romans do, have their coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: ASATraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in a nice neighborhood. It's not especially close to any of the sights, although it's only a 7 minute walk to a metro station. The staff were not helpful in addressing problems. Our room was ant infested. We came back one evening to find the ants crawling all around our room and in the bed. We just took the bedspread and placed it outside our room. The rooms on the street-side are loud. While the windows are soundproofed, the rest of the room is not. Even with the windows being soundproofed, you can still hear the traffic and trams coming by. Plus, it was 70 degrees outside and the hotel was running the heat incessantly. While the hotel advertises as air conditioned, they had it off. My husband and I had to keep the windows open at night due to the heat. They also charge 7 euros for three hours of internet and don't provide receipts for the purchase. The breakfast leaves much to be desired. I would avoid rooms on the 100-level, as they are right beside the breakfast room. Also, room 113 in the basement smelled like there had been water leakage. Additionally, one morning my shower was cold. And - the room we had was so tiny that only one person could walk around the room at a time. However, the room had been recently refurbished, but it doesn't make up for the other miserable aspects of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: princess027
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. We had our doubts when walking down the side street it is situated on, but as soon as my family walked through those doors we were amazed, its clean and quiet, and the chandelier just finishes it all off! breakfast is small but we were satisfied. It is only 2 stops on the metro to the centre of Rome so your away from the real hustle and bustle of the city. The rooms were really nice too we stayed for a long weekend but I could have eaily stayed there longer. No coffee or tea facilities but a fridge to store any drinks bought outside of the hotel which is good. some reviews have said about the noise and trust me the double glazing is enough to take away any of that. Me and my partner were in the back of the hotel which was quiet anyway, but my parents were at the front, with the window open it was noisy because of traffic but once the window was closed you couldnt hear a thing. Air con in the room which was good too if you got too hot in the night. lovely resteraunts just around the corner too which were amazing, ask the reception they will be happy to help. I seriously couldnt doubt this hotel at all, we had an amazing time in Rome and came home each evening to a lovely room and a lovely hotel. Please visit

Reviews.Title: “Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: waterdrop20
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice and clean, staffs are very friendly and helpful. However, the area around the hotel is not that safe, the first day we went back to the hotel early at around 5pm, and we had two guys following us at the last half block on our way back to the hotel, we tried to walk faster and faster, and we were also lucky to have some other people walked out the hotel when we were almost near to the front door, so we were safe. We end up took the taxi back to the hotel every night. It is safe to walk around the hotel in the morning, but will definitely not recommend to walk back to the hotel at night. It was a scary experience!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: science_299
Reviews.Content: We got sent to this hotel after booking elsewhere with Air Miles only to find that the hotel was full, so it wasn't our first choice by any means. I'm female and was travelling alone and wasn't pleased when I turned up at check-in time after a 12 hour trip and was turned away because the room wasn't ready - I ended up wandering around with my case for an hour and a half. Having finally got to the room I closed the blinds and tried to get a nap but totally failed due to the considerable noise coming from the workmen nearby which was not mentioned when I checked in. When I did finally get to sleep, the door entry system kept crackling and eventually exploded in flames! So I had to quickly get dressed and run around trying to find someone to have a look. I spent the night in the room without a working card lock and without much confidence in the electrics either. The room and ensuite were both clean, comfortable and nicely done out but extremely small; there was barely enough room to walk around the bed. Full-length windows facing the incredible gardens out back were a nice touch though I would have preferred a bit of space to unpack. Having said that, the staff were polite and helpful, and spoke good English which was a relief.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel to anybody.”
Reviews.Author: p42454
Reviews.Content: We had our doubts. But when we arrived, we were pleasantly surprised. The staff were very helpful. Accomodation though small was excellent, very clean, wardrobe/drawer space limited, no tea making facilities in the room, but asked the staff about making a cuppa for us,no problem. Breakfast continental, adequate choice. There was some refurbishment going on during our stay, but this did not intefere in anyway. Good location for all the usual tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and quaint, with a dash of fancy!”
Reviews.Author: moonseed
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more than adorable and spotless to boot. I would stay here again in a heartbeat! Cons - There were no tissues – the only thing around was pretty poor toilet paper. - No free internet – it costs a whopping 7 Euros for 3 hours, but was wireless. - There was construction right outside the window. It didn’t really affect anything, it was just noisy and started at 7:00 in the morning. Perhaps they’re putting in a pool. - The nighttime front desk clerk was not so good – he was okay with English but told us to “figure out restaurant locations ourselves”. - Be prepared – the rooms are small, even for European rooms. But just enough room for two suitcases. - The hotel doesn’t have a dishwasher, so the poor woman attending the breakfast area had to do all the dishes by hand, which meant at points there were no bowls, or no spoons, or knives, or coffee cups… - No washcloths; as per usual of all European hotels. Pros - Breakfast was free! At least I think it was free; we never quite figured out where to pay for it or how to put it on our bill, so we’re only assuming. It was limited in choice, but still good for free – cereals (good granola, and something resembling cocoa puffs), baked goods, juice and coffee maker coffee. - Could control your own heat/air conditioning - perfect! Also could open the windows and adjust the shutters too. Made you feel like a true Roman. - Pretty close the Colosseum, about a 15 minute walk. - The daytime front desk clerk was great – he knew great English and always had a smile on his face. - The room was beautifully decorated! From what I read, all the rooms are immaculate, but room 401 was superb. Also, because the hotel is so new, the rooms were spotless and clean! - Very close the train station, which made it very convenient to take the train to Napoli and Firenze! - For as small as the room is, it had a fridge! Very convenient for storing some cheese bought at the supermarket. - Super new elevator – you know it’s new because it has blue LEDs for the buttons. Though, the button for the downstairs floor where you eat breakfast has a down arrow when it should be an up arrow. Not sure if that’s a bad sign or not. Tips - Water is a must, but don’t be ripped off by the convenience store clerk down the street – walk just a bit further to your right and across the street you’ll find a very reasonably priced supermarket, where you can buy 6 packs of water for 2 Euros! Remember to get “naturale” water – the other stuff has bubbles, blech. - There are two or three good restaurants, even if the hotel doesn’t know about them (they only recommend the one, it’s okay, but I’m not sure why.) Turn right out of the front door and go to the first intersection with traffic lights and turn right. Aim to eat dinner around 8 or later, if you want to be a true Roman. And buy a ½ litre of wine – you can’t beat the price! - Buy a Roma Pass in the airport, which gives you free transportation for 3 days and entrances for free into two museums or archeological sites (great for skipping the lines too, just that alone is worth it!)

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: Natrah76
Reviews.Content: Having found this hotel on the net last minute , I can say that we had a pleasant 3 night stay in Best Hotel. The rooms are very, very small but very comfortable. Room came with LCD TV on wall, mini bar, wifi (at a charge) and aircon/heater and decorated tastefully. It seemed the hotel had very recently been renovated and work was still going on during our stay. Breakfast was basic cereals, bread and coffee /nice juice...... One word of warning, my partner and I popped up to the roof terrace for a ciggie but got locked out of the hotel, and there was no way of geting back in as there was no door handle to open up the door! Luckily my partner had brought his mobile, so we were able to call the concierge. I hope the manager has rectified this problem as we would have been stuck there for ages! Perfect location - 15 minute walking distance to the colloseum and around the same from Termini Station (although it was quite difficult to find at first - I would recommend getting a taxi). Close to a few resturants (pizza, chinese etc) and a great supermarket for hams/cheese I would stay again as I found the hotel good value for money and close to the Manzoni metro staton,which enabled us to explore Rome quite easily.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel for our city break”
Reviews.Author: TheSaint1
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews about this hotel on TripAdvisor, we were unsure as to what to expect from the hotel, but upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were quite small, but there was space for everything we needed, as well as in the bath and shower room. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated - and the air con was greatly appreciated in the Rome heat! The hotel was easy to find, being only about a 10 minute walk from Rome Termini and located nearby to the hotel were restaurants, a local grocery/supermarket and an internet cafe. It is also only about a 10/15 minute walk to the Coloseum. The area near the hotel did look a little 'scary' at night, but we experienced no problems and didn't feel unsafe. The breakfast was small with limited table space, but the selection of food (mainly cereals, croissants) was fine. The service in the hotel was fine too - not the world's friendliest staff...but they did come and unlock the bathroom door for one of our family members who had become locked in the bathroom after the door had jammed shut! In terms of Rome itself, we particularly enjoyed visiting the Coloseum and the Vatican City as well as taking trips to the Pantheon and the Trevi Fountain. We would recommend one of the open top bus tours that is reasonably priced and provides you with transport for 48 hours as well as conveniently stopping at all the major attractions. The graffiti is all over Rome - it seems such a shame that people do not take pride in their city, but that said, nothing spoiled our trip. Overall, this was a lovely little hotel that was ideal for our city break to Rome and we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A GEM OF A HOTEL - REASONABLE AND VERY CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: lyloc
Reviews.Content: I don't understand how this great hotel could get a bad review?? We stayed here for a week from the 21st of July until August 1st and again on Augus 7th. It is VERY easy to walk to from the ROMA TERMINI. Without exact directions it took us 10 minutes. The hotel is small and very clean. It is relatively new and our room was beautiful. Yes, it was very small, but who needs space when your in Rome! The bathroom was all marble and the room was nice. It had a fridge, a wall mounted LCD television and a very comfortable bed.. From the hotel it is a 15 minute walk to the Ancient City or for those that prefer, a 5 minute Subway ride. Yes, there is alot of Grafitti but it is EVERYWHERE in Rome, not just the area of the hotel. There is a great grocery store less than half a block away where you can stock up on water, beer, juice and snacks. We paid 65 euro's a night and felt like it was an amazing bargain. The breakfast is more than you need, and the coffee is excellent. There are many local resteraunts all within a few blocks. If I had any complaints it would be one of the front desk staff was very cold and at times rude. However, we certainly did not let his behaviour ruin our trip! We had an amazing time in Rome, and I would not hesitate to reccommend the Hotel Best Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: cherries105
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this Hotel at the end of July. We booked this based on some good reviews and the cost. We were not disappointed. Our room was very modern, clean, bright and fresh. We had clean towels and maid service daily. The room was fairly small ( but we expected this after reading reviews and based on the fact we knew we would be out and about sightseeing for the most part, this didn't pose any problems. Breakfast was a selection of cereals, breads and croissants with coffe and juice. All fresh, with good coffee. The staff were all very pleasant and welcoming. We spoke with the concierge on the first day after we arrived because there was a small problem with our bed, and when we returned after a day of sightseeing the problem had been rectified. The hotel is easily accessible on foot from the metro. Although I have read some negative reviews on the area the hotel is situated, we didn't feel threatened venturing out in the evening. There is a considerable amount of graffitti and refuse but this seemed to be throughout Rome (aside from the central tourist piazzas, etc). If you have not visited Rome previously, be warned, it is extremely expensive. I am so glad I have visited the wonderful sights of the Colosseum, The Vatican and the stunning Trevi Fountain, etc. However, I will not want to return because it is sooo expensive and quite a dirty city. (We did throw the coins though!)

Reviews.Title: “Not Great. I would pick another hotel next time in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: mm1771
Reviews.Content: It was OK. When we arrived (at 11am) the conceirge was not very helpful. We asked when our room would be ready and without looking up he said, "after two". Gee, thanks. We were told to put our bags downstairs in a cleaning spot where they keep vaccuums? It was not locked or secure - it didn't even have a door, so we took our bags with us instead. The biggest issue was our room. It was clean. HOwever, after a day out we arrived to our washroom which had been flooded by a plumbing problem? I had left a couple articles of clothing on the floor which were completely drenched with sewage water and everything smelled terribly. We immeidately told the front desk and he came upstairs and said he'd call a plumber. He told us we were NOT able to take a shower until after the plumber came. So, we waited in our stinky room for a few hours and nobody came. We went out for dinner and came back and still nobody came. We inquired at the front desk again and he told us the plumber was coming the next day. So we went to bed without showers. After 2pm the following day (more than 24 hours after the flooding), still nobody arrived so we asked yet another time. We were very frustrated because we were paying for amentities and we couldn't even shower. Eventually someone came that evening, way more than 24 hours later, and nobody even apologized. We should have been compinsated in someway. I should also mention they were not willing to give us another room. They said they were fully booked, although I am not certain. Finally, before you arrive get directions from the subway. It is hard to find the hotel when you get off the subway station if you do not already have the directions. It is not visible from the subway station by any means you have to go on a coule different streets.

Reviews.Title: “a very nice experience at this hotel--an excellent find for us”
Reviews.Author: bur03
Reviews.Content: there is a terrific market across the street from the hotel to pick up cheeses, fruits and yogurt, etc . to keep in the room.....breakfast was the same each morning and we did stay six nights...........a must is the gelato store two blocks away, however, not on a Sunday night being the wait is over and hour it seemed to be a family night ...the best treat after touring all day to sit down and enjoy...........the hotel was easy to get around Rome from................the front desk helpful and our room was kept very clean................being we were there for a number of nights we would have enjoyed putting on the t.v. and having english sub titles or a cnn chanel to view.................

Reviews.Title: “not bad, but NOT a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: mspisars
Reviews.Content: Not sure how they got their 4 star raiting, but there is no way this hotel can be rated as 4 stars. The location is not too bad...walking distance to Colesium (about 10 min walking), close to Metro, but the rooms are VERY small (barely could fit in the shower). The guy at the front desk is not friendly...so the concept of 'customer-service' is not there. No free internet (most hotels offer that), and we had to wait in line to get breakfast because there was not enough tables (once again, the dining room was too small). So, how can it be 4 stars, when the hotel doesn't even have a restaurant, or a fitness center, or a business center?!?! Overall it's bearable, but not what I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Lets not go there, it is after all a rather silly place”
Reviews.Author: Chance1234
Reviews.Content: Where to begin! This was the start of our honeymoon and we thought we would treat ourselves to one of the suites, which was not cheap. On arrival, there was no help with our luggage, we were on the second floor and would of taken the lift, but that hadn;t been finished being built yet. so instead it was up a tight stairwell with a wonderful view of more building work gong on. The room was just passable as a suite, it was more a large room divided into two. I would say on the positive the room was well furnished and the bathroom was very nice. We didnt eat breakfast at the hotel as the dining area looked really dark an uninviting. It is laughably bad considering the price we paid , in vengance we stole their uk adapter and they are not having it back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yeadon24
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this hotel, chosen mainly for its price and location. Its very small and not very noticable from the street. Although the rooms are quite small, everything is very nicely decorated and clean. It is about a 10 min walk to the Manzoni subway station and about 20 mins to the collesium. We didn't explore the area around the hotel, but there didn't appear to be many restaurants. There are a couple of cafes close by that sell pastries and drinks etc. Thre is however a complementary conntinental breakfast which means you can quickly eat and be on your way for sight seeing!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: anitka
Reviews.Content: i was there in 26-29.01.2009 ,and my holiday was great.The hotel is small but comfortable,clean and all stuff is very kind. next time i go to Rome i go there again.I like it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BACW
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in Rome at Hotel Roma and were thrilled with the experience. It's relatively close to the train station and at first glance after dark the neighborhood looked a bit rough. We were happy to find that despite our first impression we felt very safe walking after dark to a restaurant few blocks away. The metro line is nearby and we were able to quickly get to all of the sites we wanted to see that way. The hotel itself is lovely. Everything was clean and comfortable, and the hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They definitely went above and beyond to meet our needs. We would not hesitate to recommend Hotel Best Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: silverjet737
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent 3 days in Rome at this hotel and found it to be exactly as advertised. We couldn't have been happier. They did a beautiful job remodeling and the rooms were modern and very nicely done. They offer an ample continental breakfast in the morning and the staff could not be nicer or more helpful. The location is with in walking distance of the Coliseum and the subway which makes the location very convenient. I would not hesitate to stay here the next time I travel to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Compact but everything you need”
Reviews.Author: ggmon76
Reviews.Content: Not a bad little hotel, an easy walk from the main station, 5 mins from the nearest metro (the cleanest underground station i have ever been to and really good value for getting around) 10 mins walk from the sights.
