It IS undergoing some work at the moment, but it didnt effect us at all, work didnt start until after 9am and stopped by 5pm, we WERE on the opposite side of the hotel though and i can understand it may be worse if you were right next to the work. The bedroom was tiny, we had a small overnight case and if we had had anything bigger we wouldnt have been able to move, that said, it was newly decorated, the bed was more comfortable than my one at home, and it had everything you need. The bathroom was also very small but all new and the shower was fab (although my other half at over 6 foot tall suffered a few knocked elbows as he tried to wash his hair), all in all though it was fine for 3 or 4 nights - any longer and you may get cabin fever. One thing i would suggest is requesting a room on the back of the hotel, ours was on the front and the road noise was quite bad, it is on a major road with buses, cars bikes and trams every few minutes (and you know how the Italians love to beep their horns) and the view wasnt worth the noise. It didnt stop us sleeping but some light sleepers may find it a problem, mind you if the road doesnt wake you up the usual inconsiderate shouting Germans will, so its not really worth worrying about!! Breakfast was great, fresh pastries and rolls from the bakery every morning, cereals and hot drinks and juice - we filled up at breakfast and didnt really need lunch! There are not really any places to eat near the hotel, but within a 10 min walk you can find some. In the main you cant go wrong, its good value for money, the rooms though small were new, clean and had everything you need, the front desk is manned 24/7, good breakfast and location for the sights and rail links. The only down point is its location within Rome, this is not a particuly nice area, its the poorest and most industrial part of the city, very very dirty and covered in graffiti, we were a little nervous walking from Termini to the hotel (which we had no problems at all finding by the way!!) and i imagine in high season there will be a lot of pick pockets and gypsies around the station, but although we were a bit edgy at first we had no problems at all, everyone was friendly enough and once you are used to the look of the place it doesnt seem so bad, there are also a lot of tourists about so you are not alone. At the end of the day you want a hotel next to the Trevi Fountain then you will pay 3 times the price of this one and it probably wont be in such a nice condition. I would certainly go back to this hotel, once they finish the work i think it will be a little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but amenities list a bit of a lie”
Reviews.Author: BrianinMD
Reviews.Content: On the amenities list at the site we booked from, Hotel Best Roma indicated bathrobes, slippers and free wireless in the common areas. They had none of the above. Other than that the place was great. Standard, maybe even a slightly bigger than Euro-average size room. The breakfast was good with pastries and a very wide selection of coffees from the machine. Something they don't advertise but is nice is the rooftop lounge, which with a couple of chaise lounges or comfortable chairs would be really nice in the summertime.

Reviews.Title: “Brillant City, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: B_Bush1
Reviews.Content: A great location just out the center of Rome but a 5 minute walk from the Metro A line so easy to get to all of Rome's main sights, restaurants and districts. The room we had was the black room shown on the site here and was a great size, not huge but decorated to a high standard and the rain shower was a god send after a days walking. The staff were great. Rooms cleaned everyday, fresh towels and reception were always on hand to point you in the right direction. One tip is take a comfy pair of shoes as you'll find you won't stop walking things to see around every corner. Also don't get sucked in by tour touts by the main sights they seem to be rip of merchants. We booked a few trips through www.viator.com and they were great. Vatican City no need for tour guides. Book this hotel and you won't be disappointed we will be going back there for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: BubbaandBibber
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel, Its a little out of the way but well within walking distance of the colleseo and the forum and also near the very efficient Metro system.The room we had was beautifully decorated with marble and a chandelier, Flat screen TV mini bar etc. In fact, the whole hotel was beautifully decorated and kept. Breakfast was very good for Roma with fresh bread rolls, butter/jam/honey, cheese, pastries, cereals orange juice and coffee/tea/hot chocolate etc. This was topped up regularly by the women who doubled up as chambermaids - very efficient. The Staff were very good, friendly and knowledgeable, speaking perfect english too. The room was cleaned to a high standard every day. The only thing about the room was that the shower seemed quite small - but then again I am a 6ft rugby framed bloke so anything seems a little on the small side for me. We totally recomend this hotel, I think you would struggle to find better for the price and we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: TravelerByDay
Reviews.Content: My brother and I arrived at the Hotel Best Roma on Christmas Eve. After exiting our cab, we had to search a bit as the hotel entrance is subtle, without an obvious sign except a red floor mat outside the small front door (for future reference, it's across the street from the big Fiat dealership). We were greeted cheerfully by the desk clerk who gave us our key and told us the times and place for breakfast each morning. He also provided a city map and outlined a detailed description of the streets, shopping, restaurants, and sights of Rome. Finally, he told us where to find the nearest metro line. Also helpful, he spoke excellent English. The hotel has a good location, out-of-the-way but within walking distance (when not lugging heavy bags) of a city tourism office, the Coliseum, and several other sights. Also in the area: metro access, a couple of small grocery stores, and a cheap pizza place that is open late. We stayed in a spacious room with two twin beds and tasteful decor - black with pale gold accents. One perk: there were enough electrical outlets for us to plug in our computers and charge our cellphones and cameras. Another: the lights and TV work only when the room key is in its slot on the wall, helping to prevent guests from a) losing the room key and b) wasting electricity by leaving a light on when they leave. Our view out of the shuttered window was of the rooftops and backyards of the buildings behind the hotel. The bathroom had two shower heads - one normal and one rain - and the towels were huge. Breakfast in the morning was ample: bread, butter/jam/honey, cheese, pastries, cereal with milk, coffee/tea/hot chocolate from an espresso machine, and orange juice. My only qualm was that internet access is not included in the price of the room; however, the access cards provided by the hotel staff were easy to use. Additionally, the hotel website is comprehensive and easy to use.
